site.title: Respiratory System Modeling Consultancy
site.description: Advanced respiratory research and modeling solutions by Airflow Inferred LLC

papers.title: The effect of including dynamic imaging derived airway wall motion in CFD simulations of respiratory airflow in patients with OSA
papers.authors: Xiao, Q; Gunatilaka, C; McConnell, K; Bates, A
papers.abstract: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is caused by periodic airway collapse during sleep. This study shows that discrepancies between dynamic and static wall simulations are subject-specific, with total pressure loss differing by up to 400% between static and dynamic simulations.

papers.title: Effects of decongestion on nasal cavity air conditioning efficiency: a CFD cohort study
papers.authors: Xiao, Q; Bates, AJ; Doorly, DJ
papers.abstract: CFD analysis of how nasal decongestion affects air conditioning efficiency in the nasal cavity, with implications for understanding nasal function and obstruction.

papers.title: Effect of airway wall motion on particle deposition and delivery in the neonatal trachea
papers.authors: Gunatilaka, CC; McKenzie, C; Xiao, Q; Higano, NS; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.abstract: Investigation of how airway wall motion affects particle deposition and drug delivery in neonatal airways using computational modeling.

papers.title: Tracheomalacia Reduces Aerosolized Drug Delivery to the Lung
papers.authors: Gunatilaka, CC; McKenzie, C; Hysinger, EB; Xiao, Q; Higano, NS; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.journal: Journal of Aerosol Medicine and Pulmonary Drug Delivery
papers.abstract: Demonstrates that tracheomalacia significantly reduces drug delivery efficiency to the lungs, with important implications for treating neonates with airway malacia.

papers.title: The interaction between neuromuscular forces, aerodynamic forces, and anatomical motion in the upper airway predicts severity
papers.authors: Xiao, Q; Ignatiuk, D; McConnell, K; Gunatilaka, C; Schuh, A; Fleck, R; Ishman, S; Amin, R; Bates, A
papers.abstract: Analysis of how neuromuscular forces, aerodynamic forces, and anatomical motion interact to predict upper airway obstruction severity in sleep apnea patients.

papers.title: Computational assessment of upper airway muscular activity in obstructive sleep apnea
papers.authors: Ignatiuk, D; Xiao, Q; McConnell, K; Fleck, R; Schuler, C; Schuh, A; Amin, R; Bates, A
papers.abstract: Computational assessment of upper airway neuromuscular activity in patients with obstructive sleep apnea using biomechanical modeling.

papers.title: Predicting tracheal work of breathing in neonates based on radiological and pulmonary measurements
papers.authors: Gunatilaka, CC; Hysinger, EB; Schuh, A; Xiao, Q; Gandhi, DB; Higano, NS; Ignatiuk, D; Hossain, MM; Fleck, RJ; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.abstract: Development of methods to predict tracheal work of breathing in neonates using radiological and pulmonary measurements, enabling non-invasive assessment.

papers.title: Human upper-airway respiratory airflow: In vivo comparison of computational fluid dynamics simulations and hyperpolarized 129Xe phase contrast MRI velocimetry
papers.authors: Xiao, Q; Stewart, NJ; Willmering, MM; Gunatilaka, CC; Thomen, RP; Schuh, A; Krishnamoorthy, G; Wang, H; Amin, RS; Dumoulin, CL; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.abstract: First in vivo validation of CFD simulations against hyperpolarized 129Xe MRI velocity measurements in human airways, demonstrating good agreement between computational and experimental methods.

papers.title: Neonates With Tracheomalacia Generate Auto-Positive End-Expiratory Pressure via Glottis Closure
papers.authors: Gunatilaka, CC; Hysinger, EB; Schuh, A; Gandhi, DB; Higano, NS; Xiao, Q; Hahn, AD; Fain, SB; Fleck, RJ; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.abstract: Discovery that neonates with tracheomalacia generate auto-PEEP through glottis closure, a compensatory mechanism to maintain airway patency.

papers.title: The effect of decongestion on nasal airway patency and airflow
papers.authors: Xiao, Q; Bates, AJ; Cetto, R; Doorly, DJ
papers.abstract: CFD study of how nasal decongestion affects airway patency and airflow patterns, with clinical implications for treating nasal obstruction.

papers.title: Increased Work of Breathing due to Tracheomalacia in Neonates
papers.authors: Gunatilaka, CC; Higano, NS; Hysinger, EB; Gandhi, DB; Fleck, RJ; Hahn, AD; Fain, SB; Woods, JC; Bates, AJ
papers.journal: Annals of the American Thoracic Society
papers.abstract: Quantification showing tracheal work of breathing increased by 337% in neonates with tracheomalacia compared to 24% in those without, demonstrating significant clinical impact.

papers.title: The Effect of Airway Motion and Breathing Phase During Imaging on CFD Simulations of Respiratory Airflow
papers.authors: Bates, AJ; Schuh, A; Krishnamoorthy, G; Thomen, RP; Woods, JC
papers.abstract: Demonstrates that airway motion during breathing significantly affects CFD predictions, with implications for timing of medical imaging.

papers.title: Assessing the relationship between movement and airflow in the upper airway using computational fluid dynamics with motion determined from magnetic resonance imaging
papers.authors: Bates, AJ; Schuh, A; Krishnamoorthy, G; Thomen, RP; Dumoulin, CL; Woods, JC
papers.abstract: Pioneering study establishing methods to incorporate airway wall motion from MRI into CFD simulations, enabling dynamic airway modeling.
